intro: Psoralea discolor, commonly known as the variable psoralea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, featuring small, often hairy leaves and yellow or white flowers. Its seed pods are elongated and contain several small, dark seeds. Psoralea discolor is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing resilience to drought conditions.
